src/list-with-us.jsx ← ListWithUsPage 257→[WHY_SPLIT_LEASE]: why-split-lease.html ← src/why-split-lease.jsx ← WhySplitLeasePage 258→[GUEST_SUCCESS]: guest-success.html ← src/guest-success.jsx ← GuestSuccessPage 259→[HOST_SUCCESS]: host-success.html ← src/host-success.jsx ← HostSuccessPage 260→[FAVORITE_LISTINGS]: favorite-listings.html ← src/favorite-listings.jsx ← FavoriteListingsPage 261→[RENTAL_APPLICATION]: rental-application.html ← src/rental-application.jsx ← RentalApplicationPage 262→[RESET_PASSWORD]: reset-password.html ← src/reset-password.jsx ← ResetPasswordPage 263→[NOT_FOUND]: 404.html ← src/404.jsx ← NotFoundPage 264→[SEARCH_TEST]: search-test.html ← src/search-test.jsx ← SearchPageTest 265→[INTERNAL_TEST]: _internal-test.html ← src/_internal-test.jsx ← InternalTestPage 266→ 267→--- 268→ 269→## ARCHITECTURE_PATTERNS 270→ 271→### Islands Architecture 272→[DESCRIPTION]: Each HTML page is an independent React root 273→[BENEFIT]: No shared state between pages, simpler mental model 274→[NAVIGATION]: Full page loads (no client-side routing) 275→[STATE_PERSISTENCE]: URL params, localStorage, Supabase database 276→ 277→### Route Registry Pattern 278→[DESCRIPTION]: Single source of truth for all routes in src/routes.config.js 279→[CONSUMERS]: Vite dev server, Vite preview, Cloudflare _redirects, Vite build inputs 280→[BENEFIT]: Change route once, updates everywhere 281→[VALIDATION]: Automated checks in generate-redirects.js 282→ 283→### Cloudflare _internal Pattern 284→[DESCRIPTION]: Copy HTML files to dist/_internal/ with custom names 285→[WHY]: Avoid Cloudflare's automatic 308 redirects that strip query params/hash 286→[USAGE]: Dynamic routes and pages needing query/hash preservation 287→[EXAMPLE]: /search → /_internal/search-view 288→ 289→### Hollow Component Pattern 290→[DESCRIPTION]: Page components delegate all logic to custom hooks 291→[BENEFIT]: Testable business logic, focused UI components 292→[LOCATION]: src/islands/pages/ 293→[EXAMPLE]: ViewSplitLeasePage.jsx (UI only) + useViewSplitLeasePageLogic.js (logic) 294→ 295→### Four-Layer Logic Architecture 296→[DESCRIPTION]: Business logic separated into calculators, rules, processors, workflows 297→[LOCATION]: src/logic/ 298→[LAYER_1]: Calculators (pure math functions: calculate*, get*) 299→[LAYER_2]: Rules (boolean predicates: can*, is*, has*, should*) 300→[LAYER_3]: Processors (data transformation: adapt*, extract*, process*, format*) 301→[LAYER_4]: Workflows (orchestration: *Workflow) 302→[BENEFIT]: Reusable, testable, maintainable business logic 303→ 304→--- 305→ 306→## ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES 307→ 308→### Frontend (VITE_ prefix) 309→[VITE_SUPABASE_URL]: Supabase project URL (from Supabase dashboard) 310→[VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY]: Supabase anonymous key (public, safe for client) 311→[VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY]: Google Maps JavaScript API key 312→ 313→### Backend (Supabase Secrets) 314→[BUBBLE_API_BASE_URL]: Bubble.io API endpoint (legacy backend) 315→[BUBBLE_API_KEY]: Bubble.io API authentication 316→[OPENAI_API_KEY]: OpenAI API for AI features 317→[SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY]: Supabase admin key (server-side only) 318→ 319→### Configuration Location 320→[FRONTEND_ENV]: app/.env (local), Cloudflare Pages settings (production) 321→[BACKEND_SECRETS]: Supabase Dashboard → Project Settings → Edge Functions Secrets 322→[SECURITY]: Never expose Bubble/OpenAI keys in frontend code 323→ 324→--- 325→ 326→## CRITICAL_CONVENTIONS 327→ 328→### Day Indexing 329→[JS_FORMAT]: 0-6 (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ..., Saturday=6) 330→[BUBBLE_FORMAT]: 1-7 (Sunday=1, Monday=2, ..., Saturday=7) 331→[CONVERSION_FUNCTIONS]: adaptDaysFromBubble(), adaptDaysToBubble() 332→[LOCATION]: src/logic/processors/external/ 333→[RULE]: Always convert at API boundaries, never mix formats 334→ 335→### Unique ID Generation 336→[METHOD]: Supabase RPC function generate_bubble_id 337→[USAGE]: const { data: newId } = await supabaseAdmin.rpc('generate_bubble_id') 338→[FORMAT]: 17-character alphanumeric string (Bubble-compatible) 339→ 340→### API Architecture 341→[FRONTEND_TO_BACKEND]: Frontend → Supabase Edge Functions → Bubble API 342→[DIRECT_SUPABASE]: Frontend → Supabase Database (for Supabase-native tables) 343→[NEVER]: Frontend → Bubble API directly (security violation) 344→ 345→--- 346→ 347→## DO_RULES 348→ 349→[DO_USE_ROUTE_REGISTRY]: Always update src/routes.config.js for route changes 350→[DO_GENERATE_ROUTES]: Run bun run generate-routes after route config changes 351→[DO_USE_EDGE_FUNCTIONS]: Proxy all Bubble API calls through Supabase Edge Functions 352→[DO_STORE_SECRETS]: Keep API keys in Supabase Secrets, never in frontend 353→[DO_COMMIT_CHANGES]: Git commit after each logical change (per project instructions) 354→[DO_USE_ESM]: Use ES modules (import/export), not CommonJS 355→[DO_USE_BUN]: Prefer bun for package management and script execution 356→[DO_USE_HOLLOW_PATTERN]: Keep page components minimal, delegate logic to hooks 357→[DO_USE_FOUR_LAYERS]: Organize business logic into calculators/rules/processors/workflows 358→[DO_CONVERT_DAYS]: Use adaptDaysFromBubble/adaptDaysToBubble at API boundaries 359→ 360→--- 361→ 362→## DONT_RULES 363→ 364→[DONT_EDIT_GENERATED]: Never manually edit _redirects or _routes.json (auto-generated) 365→[DONT_EXPOSE_KEYS]: Never put Bubble/OpenAI API keys in frontend code or .env 366→[DONT_SKIP_VALIDATION]: Always run generate-redirects.js validation before deploying 367→[DONT_CALL_BUBBLE_DIRECTLY]: Never call Bubble API from frontend (security risk) 368→[DONT_MIX_DAY_FORMATS]: Never use 0-based and 1-based days in same function 369→[DONT_PUSH_FORCE]: Never git push --force to main/master 370→[DONT_ADD_FALLBACKS]: No fallback mechanisms when encountering errors (per project philosophy) 371→[DONT_OVER_ENGINEER]: Match solution to actual scale, not hypothetical future needs 372→[DONT_MODIFY_DB]: Never modify Supabase tables without explicit instruction 373→ 374→--- 375→ 376→## RELATED_DOCUMENTATION 377→ 378→[PROJECT_ROOT]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\.claude\CLAUDE.md 379→[SOURCE_CODE]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\CLAUDE.md 380→[SUPABASE]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\supabase\CLAUDE.md 381→[DATABASE_SCHEMA]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\DATABASE_SCHEMA_OVERVIEW.md 382→[ROUTING_GUIDE]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\.claude\Documentation\Routing\ROUTING_GUIDE.md 383→ Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. # App Directory - LLM Reference **GENERATED**: 2025-12-11 **SCOPE**: Frontend application root - Configuration, build tools, static assets, entry points **OPTIMIZATION**: Semantic Searchability + Digestibility --- ## QUICK_STATS [TOTAL_ROOT_FILES]: 9 [TOTAL_SUBDIRECTORIES]: 6 [PRIMARY_LANGUAGE]: JavaScript/TypeScript (React 18) [BUILD_TOOL]: Vite 5.0 [ARCHITECTURE]: Islands Architecture [DEPLOYMENT]: Cloudflare Pages [KEY_PATTERNS]: Multi-page app, Route Registry, Islands pattern, ESM modules --- ## ROOT_FILES ### package.json [INTENT]: NPM package configuration and dependency management [TYPE]: ESM module (type: "module") [SCRIPTS]: dev (port 8000), build, preview, generate-routes, prebuild [DEPENDENCIES]: React 18, Supabase client, Google Maps React, date-fns, framer-motion, react-hook-form, zod, styled-components [DEV_DEPENDENCIES]: Vite 5, @vitejs/plugin-react, esbuild, supabase CLI [RUNTIME]: Bun preferred, Node compatible ### vite.config.js [INTENT]: Vite bundler configuration for multi-page React application [PLUGINS]: @vitejs/plugin-react, multi-page-routing middleware, move-html-to-root post-build [ROUTING_LOGIC]: Shared routing function for dev and preview servers using Route Registry [BUILD_INPUT]: 27 HTML entry points from public/ directory [BUILD_OUTPUT]: dist/ with HTML at root, assets in dist/assets/ [DEV_SERVER]: Port 8000, localhost + 127.0.0.1, /api proxy to wrangler (port 8788) [PREVIEW_SERVER]: Port 8000, 127.0.0.1 [POST_BUILD_TASKS]: Move HTML to dist root, copy assets/, copy _redirects, copy _headers, copy _routes.json, create _internal/ files, copy images/, copy help-center-articles/, copy functions/ [IMPORTS]: routes, getInternalRoutes, getBasePath, buildRollupInputs from src/routes.config.js ### tsconfig.json [INTENT]: TypeScript compiler configuration for React app [TARGET]: ES2020 [MODULE]: ESNext [JSX]: react-jsx [MODE]: Bundler mode resolution [STRICT]: Disabled (strict: false) [INCLUDE]: src directory [ALLOW_JS]: true [NO_EMIT]: true (type checking only, Vite handles compilation) ### tsconfig.node.json [INTENT]: TypeScript configuration for Node.js scripts [COMPOSITE]: true [MODULE]: ESNext [INCLUDE]: vite.config.js ### .env.example [INTENT]: Environment variable template for local development [REQUIRED_VARS]: VITE_SUPABASE_URL, VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY [OPTIONAL_VARS]: SLACK_WEBHOOK_ACQUISITION, SLACK_WEBHOOK_GENERAL [REMOVED_VARS]: VITE_BUBBLE_API_BASE_URL, VITE_BUBBLE_API_KEY (migrated to Edge Functions) [SECURITY_NOTE]: Bubble API keys now stored server-side in Supabase Secrets ### .gitignore [INTENT]: Git ignore patterns [IGNORED]: node_modules/, dist/, .env, .env.local, *.log, .DS_Store, ../input ### bun.lock [INTENT]: Bun package manager lockfile [PURPOSE]: Reproducible dependency installation ### .gitkeep-functions [INTENT]: Placeholder to keep functions directory in git --- ## SUBDIRECTORIES ### src/ [INTENT]: React application source code [CONTAINS]: Entry points (*.jsx), islands/, lib/, logic/, styles/, routes/, config/, data/ [ARCHITECTURE]: Islands Architecture with hollow components [DOCUMENTATION]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\CLAUDE.md [ENTRY_POINTS]: 27 JSX files that mount React components to HTML pages [KEY_SUBDIRS]: islands/ (React components), lib/ (utilities + API clients), logic/ (4-layer business logic), styles/ (CSS) ### public/ [INTENT]: Static assets and HTML templates for multi-page app [CONTAINS]: HTML files, assets/, images/, help-center-articles/, _redirects, _headers, _routes.json [HTML_FILES]: 27 files (index.html, search.html, view-split-lease.html, etc.) [DEPLOYMENT_FILES]: _redirects (Cloudflare routing), _headers (HTTP headers), _routes.json (Functions control) [GENERATED_FILES]: _redirects and _routes.json are auto-generated by scripts/generate-redirects.js [COPY_BEHAVIOR]: Assets copied to dist/ during build, HTML files moved to dist root ### public/assets/ [INTENT]: Static media assets [SUBDIRS]: fonts/, games/, icons/, images/, lotties/, resources/, videos/ [USAGE]: Referenced via /assets/ path in HTML/CSS ### public/images/ [INTENT]: Public image files [CONTAINS]: support-centre-icon.svg [USAGE]: Referenced via /images/ path ### public/help-center-articles/ [INTENT]: Static HTML help articles [USAGE]: Served directly by Cloudflare Pages ### scripts/ [INTENT]: Build and development scripts [FILES]: generate-redirects.js [USAGE]: Executed via npm/bun scripts (prebuild hook) ### functions/ [INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages Functions (API routes) [SUBDIRS]: api/ [FILES]: api/faq-inquiry.js [DEPLOYMENT]: Automatically deployed to /api/* routes on Cloudflare Pages [NOTE]: Most backend logic now uses Supabase Edge Functions, not Cloudflare Functions ### functions/api/ [INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages API endpoints [FILES]: faq-inquiry.js, CLAUDE.md [ROUTES]: /api/faq-inquiry [STATUS]: Deprecated in favor of Supabase Edge Functions ### dist/ [INTENT]: Production build output (generated, not in git) [STRUCTURE]: HTML at root, assets/ subdir, _internal/ subdir, functions/ copy [CREATED_BY]: vite build command [DEPLOYMENT_TARGET]: Cloudflare Pages --- ## ROUTING_SYSTEM ### src/routes.config.js [INTENT]: Single source of truth for all application routes [EXPORTS]: routes array, apiRoutes, excludedFromFunctions, getInternalRoutes(), getBasePath(), matchRoute(), findRouteForUrl(), buildRollupInputs() [ROUTE_COUNT]: 27 routes [ROUTE_TYPES]: Static pages, dynamic routes (:id, :userId, :category), protected routes, dev-only routes [DYNAMIC_ROUTES]: /view-split-lease/:id, /preview-split-lease/:id, /guest-proposals/:userId, /account-profile/:userId, /host-proposals/:userId, /help-center/:category [PROTECTED_ROUTES]: /preview-split-lease, /guest-proposals, /account-profile, /host-proposals, /self-listing, /listing-dashboard, /host-overview, /favorite-listings, /rental-application [CLOUDFLARE_INTERNAL]: Routes using _internal/ directory to avoid 308 redirects [USAGE]: Consumed by vite.config.js, scripts/generate-redirects.js ### scripts/generate-redirects.js [INTENT]: Generate Cloudflare Pages routing files from Route Registry [EXECUTION]: prebuild hook (bun run generate-routes) [GENERATES]: public/_redirects, public/_routes.json [INPUT]: src/routes.config.js [VALIDATION]: Checks for duplicate paths, missing fields, cloudflareInternal consistency [OUTPUT_FORMAT]: _redirects (Cloudflare rewrite syntax), _routes.json (Functions control) ### public/_redirects [INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages routing configuration [GENERATED_BY]: scripts/generate-redirects.js [SYNTAX]: Cloudflare Pages redirects format [PATTERN]: path /_internal/name 200 OR path /file.html 200 [DYNAMIC_HANDLING]: Use _internal/ files to prevent Cloudflare's 308 redirects [AUTO_GENERATED]: DO NOT EDIT MANUALLY ### public/_routes.json [INTENT]: Control which routes use Cloudflare Functions [GENERATED_BY]: scripts/generate-redirects.js [INCLUDE]: /api/* (Cloudflare Functions) [EXCLUDE]: /guest-proposals, /guest-proposals/*, /host-proposals, /host-proposals/* [VERSION]: 1 --- ## BUILD_PROCESS ### Development [COMMAND]: bun run dev [PORT]: 8000 [SERVER]: Vite dev server with HMR [MIDDLEWARE]: Multi-page routing middleware using Route Registry [PUBLIC_PREFIX]: /public (proxied to public/ directory) [API_PROXY]: /api/* proxied to localhost:8788 (wrangler) ### Production Build [COMMAND]: bun run build [STEPS]: 1) Prebuild (generate routes), 2) Vite build, 3) Post-build (move HTML, copy assets) [OUTPUT]: dist/ directory [HTML_LOCATION]: dist root (e.g., dist/index.html) [ASSETS_LOCATION]: dist/assets/ with hashed filenames [INTERNAL_FILES]: dist/_internal/ (copies of HTML files for Cloudflare routing) [COPIED_DIRS]: assets/, images/, help-center-articles/, functions/ [COPIED_FILES]: _redirects, _headers, _routes.json ### Preview [COMMAND]: bun run preview [PORT]: 8000 [SERVER]: Vite preview server (serves dist/) [MIDDLEWARE]: Multi-page routing middleware using Route Registry [PUBLIC_PREFIX]: Empty string (serves from dist root) --- ## DEPLOYMENT ### Platform [TARGET]: Cloudflare Pages [BUILD_COMMAND]: bun run build [OUTPUT_DIR]: dist [NODE_VERSION]: 18 or higher [FRAMEWORK_PRESET]: None (custom Vite config) ### Routing Strategy [METHOD]: Cloudflare _redirects file + _internal directory [WHY_INTERNAL]: Avoid Cloudflare's "pretty URL" 308 redirects that strip query params/hash [DYNAMIC_ROUTES]: Rewrite to _internal/route-name files [STATIC_ROUTES]: Some use _internal/, some direct to .html ### Functions [CLOUDFLARE_FUNCTIONS]: /api/* (legacy, deprecated) [SUPABASE_EDGE_FUNCTIONS]: Preferred for all backend logic [EXCLUDED_ROUTES]: /guest-proposals/*, /host-proposals/* (no Functions processing) --- ## ENTRY_POINTS ### HTML Templates (public/*.html) [COUNT]: 27 files [PURPOSE]: Shell pages that load React apps [PATTERN]:
+ [BUILD_BEHAVIOR]: Vite processes, outputs to dist root with hashed asset references ### React Entry Points (src/*.jsx) [COUNT]: 27 files [PATTERN]: Import page component, createRoot, render to #root [EXAMPLES]: main.jsx → HomePage, search.jsx → SearchPage, view-split-lease.jsx → ViewSplitLeasePage ### Entry Point Mapping [HOMEPAGE]: index.html ← src/main.jsx ← HomePage [SEARCH]: search.html ← src/search.jsx ← SearchPage [LISTING_VIEW]: view-split-lease.html ← src/view-split-lease.jsx ← ViewSplitLeasePage [LISTING_PREVIEW]: preview-split-lease.html ← src/preview-split-lease.jsx ← PreviewSplitLeasePage [GUEST_PROPOSALS]: guest-proposals.html ← src/guest-proposals.jsx ← GuestProposalsPage [HOST_PROPOSALS]: host-proposals.html ← src/host-proposals.jsx ← HostProposalsPage [SELF_LISTING]: self-listing.html ← src/self-listing.jsx ← SelfListingPage [SELF_LISTING_V2]: self-listing-v2.html ← src/self-listing-v2.jsx ← SelfListingPageV2 [LISTING_DASHBOARD]: listing-dashboard.html ← src/listing-dashboard.jsx ← ListingDashboardPage [HOST_OVERVIEW]: host-overview.html ← src/host-overview.jsx ← HostOverviewPage [ACCOUNT_PROFILE]: account-profile.html ← src/account-profile.jsx ← AccountProfilePage [FAQ]: faq.html ← src/faq.jsx ← FAQPage [HELP_CENTER]: help-center.html ← src/help-center.jsx ← HelpCenterPage [HELP_CATEGORY]: help-center-category.html ← src/help-center-category.jsx ← HelpCenterCategoryPage [POLICIES]: policies.html ← src/policies.jsx ← PoliciesPage [CAREERS]: careers.html ← src/careers.jsx ← CareersPage [ABOUT_US]: about-us.html ← src/about-us.jsx ← AboutUsPage [LIST_WITH_US]: list-with-us.html ← src/list-with-us.jsx ← ListWithUsPage [WHY_SPLIT_LEASE]: why-split-lease.html ← src/why-split-lease.jsx ← WhySplitLeasePage [GUEST_SUCCESS]: guest-success.html ← src/guest-success.jsx ← GuestSuccessPage [HOST_SUCCESS]: host-success.html ← src/host-success.jsx ← HostSuccessPage [FAVORITE_LISTINGS]: favorite-listings.html ← src/favorite-listings.jsx ← FavoriteListingsPage [RENTAL_APPLICATION]: rental-application.html ← src/rental-application.jsx ← RentalApplicationPage [RESET_PASSWORD]: reset-password.html ← src/reset-password.jsx ← ResetPasswordPage [NOT_FOUND]: 404.html ← src/404.jsx ← NotFoundPage [SEARCH_TEST]: search-test.html ← src/search-test.jsx ← SearchPageTest [INTERNAL_TEST]: _internal-test.html ← src/_internal-test.jsx ← InternalTestPage --- ## ARCHITECTURE_PATTERNS ### Islands Architecture [DESCRIPTION]: Each HTML page is an independent React root [BENEFIT]: No shared state between pages, simpler mental model [NAVIGATION]: Full page loads (no client-side routing) [STATE_PERSISTENCE]: URL params, localStorage, Supabase database ### Route Registry Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: Single source of truth for all routes in src/routes.config.js [CONSUMERS]: Vite dev server, Vite preview, Cloudflare _redirects, Vite build inputs [BENEFIT]: Change route once, updates everywhere [VALIDATION]: Automated checks in generate-redirects.js ### Cloudflare _internal Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: Copy HTML files to dist/_internal/ with custom names [WHY]: Avoid Cloudflare's automatic 308 redirects that strip query params/hash [USAGE]: Dynamic routes and pages needing query/hash preservation [EXAMPLE]: /search → /_internal/search-view ### Hollow Component Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: Page components delegate all logic to custom hooks [BENEFIT]: Testable business logic, focused UI components [LOCATION]: src/islands/pages/ [EXAMPLE]: ViewSplitLeasePage.jsx (UI only) + useViewSplitLeasePageLogic.js (logic) ### Four-Layer Logic Architecture [DESCRIPTION]: Business logic separated into calculators, rules, processors, workflows [LOCATION]: src/logic/ [LAYER_1]: Calculators (pure math functions: calculate*, get*) [LAYER_2]: Rules (boolean predicates: can*, is*, has*, should*) [LAYER_3]: Processors (data transformation: adapt*, extract*, process*, format*) [LAYER_4]: Workflows (orchestration: *Workflow) [BENEFIT]: Reusable, testable, maintainable business logic --- ## ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES ### Frontend (VITE_ prefix) [VITE_SUPABASE_URL]: Supabase project URL (from Supabase dashboard) [VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY]: Supabase anonymous key (public, safe for client) [VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY]: Google Maps JavaScript API key ### Backend (Supabase Secrets) [BUBBLE_API_BASE_URL]: Bubble.io API endpoint (legacy backend) [BUBBLE_API_KEY]: Bubble.io API authentication [OPENAI_API_KEY]: OpenAI API for AI features [SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY]: Supabase admin key (server-side only) ### Configuration Location [FRONTEND_ENV]: app/.env (local), Cloudflare Pages settings (production) [BACKEND_SECRETS]: Supabase Dashboard → Project Settings → Edge Functions Secrets [SECURITY]: Never expose Bubble/OpenAI keys in frontend code --- ## CRITICAL_CONVENTIONS ### Day Indexing [JS_FORMAT]: 0-6 (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ..., Saturday=6) [BUBBLE_FORMAT]: 1-7 (Sunday=1, Monday=2, ..., Saturday=7) [CONVERSION_FUNCTIONS]: adaptDaysFromBubble(), adaptDaysToBubble() [LOCATION]: src/logic/processors/external/ [RULE]: Always convert at API boundaries, never mix formats ### Unique ID Generation [METHOD]: Supabase RPC function generate_bubble_id [USAGE]: const { data: newId } = await supabaseAdmin.rpc('generate_bubble_id') [FORMAT]: 17-character alphanumeric string (Bubble-compatible) ### API Architecture [FRONTEND_TO_BACKEND]: Frontend → Supabase Edge Functions → Bubble API [DIRECT_SUPABASE]: Frontend → Supabase Database (for Supabase-native tables) [NEVER]: Frontend → Bubble API directly (security violation) --- ## DO_RULES [DO_USE_ROUTE_REGISTRY]: Always update src/routes.config.js for route changes [DO_GENERATE_ROUTES]: Run bun run generate-routes after route config changes [DO_USE_EDGE_FUNCTIONS]: Proxy all Bubble API calls through Supabase Edge Functions [DO_STORE_SECRETS]: Keep API keys in Supabase Secrets, never in frontend [DO_COMMIT_CHANGES]: Git commit after each logical change (per project instructions) [DO_USE_ESM]: Use ES modules (import/export), not CommonJS [DO_USE_BUN]: Prefer bun for package management and script execution [DO_USE_HOLLOW_PATTERN]: Keep page components minimal, delegate logic to hooks [DO_USE_FOUR_LAYERS]: Organize business logic into calculators/rules/processors/workflows [DO_CONVERT_DAYS]: Use adaptDaysFromBubble/adaptDaysToBubble at API boundaries --- ## DONT_RULES [DONT_EDIT_GENERATED]: Never manually edit _redirects or _routes.json (auto-generated) [DONT_EXPOSE_KEYS]: Never put Bubble/OpenAI API keys in frontend code or .env [DONT_SKIP_VALIDATION]: Always run generate-redirects.js validation before deploying [DONT_CALL_BUBBLE_DIRECTLY]: Never call Bubble API from frontend (security risk) [DONT_MIX_DAY_FORMATS]: Never use 0-based and 1-based days in same function [DONT_PUSH_FORCE]: Never git push --force to main/master [DONT_ADD_FALLBACKS]: No fallback mechanisms when encountering errors (per project philosophy) [DONT_OVER_ENGINEER]: Match solution to actual scale, not hypothetical future needs [DONT_MODIFY_DB]: Never modify Supabase tables without explicit instruction --- ## RELATED_DOCUMENTATION [PROJECT_ROOT]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\.claude\CLAUDE.md [SOURCE_CODE]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split 278→[DESCRIPTION]: Single source of truth for all routes in src/routes.config.js 279→[CONSUMERS]: Vite dev server, Vite preview, Cloudflare _redirects, Vite build inputs 280→[BENEFIT]: Change route once, updates everywhere 281→[VALIDATION]: Automated checks in generate-redirects.js 282→ 283→### Cloudflare _internal Pattern 284→[DESCRIPTION]: Copy HTML files to dist/_internal/ with custom names 285→[WHY]: Avoid Cloudflare's automatic 308 redirects that strip query params/hash 286→[USAGE]: Dynamic routes and pages needing query/hash preservation 287→[EXAMPLE]: /search → /_internal/search-view 288→ 289→### Hollow Component Pattern 290→[DESCRIPTION]: Page components delegate all logic to custom hooks 291→[BENEFIT]: Testable business logic, focused UI components 292→[LOCATION]: src/islands/pages/ 293→[EXAMPLE]: ViewSplitLeasePage.jsx (UI only) + useViewSplitLeasePageLogic.js (logic) 294→ 295→### Four-Layer Logic Architecture 296→[DESCRIPTION]: Business logic separated into calculators, rules, processors, workflows 297→[LOCATION]: src/logic/ 298→[LAYER_1]: Calculators (pure math functions: calculate*, get*) 299→[LAYER_2]: Rules (boolean predicates: can*, is*, has*, should*) 300→[LAYER_3]: Processors (data transformation: adapt*, extract*, process*, format*) 301→[LAYER_4]: Workflows (orchestration: *Workflow) 302→[BENEFIT]: Reusable, testable, maintainable 1→/**
     2→ * Determine if a user type indicates Guest privileges.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Enforce business rules for Guest role identification.
     5→ * @rule Guest types from Supabase:
     6→ *   - "A Guest (I would like to rent a space)"
     7→ *   - "Split Lease" (internal users with both Host and Guest privileges)
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {string|null} params.userType - The user type value from Supabase or localStorage.
    11→ * @returns {boolean} True if user has Guest privileges.
    12→ *
    13→ * @example
    14→ * isGuest({ userType: 'A Guest (I would like to rent a space)' })
    15→ * // => true
    16→ *
    17→ * isGuest({ userType: 'A Host (I have a space available to rent)' })
    18→ * // => false
    19→ *
    20→ * isGuest({ userType: 'Split Lease' })
    21→ * // => true (internal users have both roles)
    22→ */
    23→export function isGuest({ userType }) {
    24→  // No user type means not authenticated or type not set
    25→  if (!userType || typeof userType !== 'string') {
    26→    return false
    27→  }
    28→
    29→  const type = userType.trim()
    30→
    31→  // Split Lease internal users have both Host and Guest privileges
    32→  if (type === 'Split Lease') {
    33→    return true
    34→  }
    35→
    36→  // Check if type includes "Guest"
    37→  return type.includes('Guest')
    38→}
    39→

1→/**
     2→ * Determine if a user type indicates Host privileges.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Enforce business rules for Host role identification.
     5→ * @rule Host types from Supabase:
     6→ *   - "A Host (I have a space available to rent)"
     7→ *   - "Trial Host"
     8→ *   - "Split Lease" (internal users with both Host and Guest privileges)
     9→ *
    10→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    11→ * @param {string|null} params.userType - The user type value from Supabase or localStorage.
    12→ * @returns {boolean} True if user has Host privileges.
    13→ *
    14→ * @example
    15→ * isHost({ userType: 'A Host (I have a space available to rent)' })
    16→ * // => true
    17→ *
    18→ * isHost({ userType: 'A Guest (I would like to rent a space)' })
    19→ * // => false
    20→ *
    21→ * isHost({ userType: 'Split Lease' })
    22→ * // => true (internal users have both roles)
    23→ */
    24→export function isHost({ userType }) {
    25→  // No user type means not authenticated or type not set
    26→  if (!userType || typeof userType !== 'string') {
    27→    return false
    28→  }
    29→
    30→  const type = userType.trim()
    31→
    32→  // Split Lease internal users have both Host and Guest privileges
    33→  if (type === 'Split Lease') {
    34→    return true
    35→  }
    36→
    37→  // Check if type includes "Host" (covers both regular and trial hosts)
    38→  return type.includes('Host')
    39→}

1→/**
     2→ * Generates user initials from first and last name for avatar display.
     3→ *
     4→ * @function processUserInitials
     5→ * @intent Create 1-2 letter initials for avatar when no profile photo available
     6→ * @rule If both names provided, use first letter of each (uppercase)
     7→ * @rule If only firstName, use first letter (uppercase)
     8→ * @rule NO FALLBACK: firstName is required, throw if missing
     9→ *
    10→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters
    11→ * @param {string} params.firstName - User's first name (required)
    12→ * @param {string|null|undefined} params.lastName - User's last name (optional)
    13→ * @returns {string} 1-2 letter initials (e.g., "JD" or "J")
    14→ * @throws {Error} If firstName is missing or invalid
    15→ *
    16→ * @example
    17→ * processUserInitials({ firstName: 'John', lastName: 'Doe' }) // "JD"
    18→ * processUserInitials({ firstName: 'Jane', lastName: null }) // "J"
    19→ * processUserInitials({ firstName: 'Bob', lastName: '' }) // "B"
    20→ * processUserInitials({ firstName: '', lastName: 'Smith' }) // throws Error
    21→ */
    22→export function processUserInitials({ firstName, lastName }) {
    23→  // NO FALLBACK: firstName is mandatory for user identity
    24→  if (typeof firstName !== 'string' || firstName.trim().length === 0) {
    25→    throw new Error('processUserInitials requires a valid firstName. Cannot generate initials without user name.');
    26→  }
    27→
    28→  // Get first letter of firstName (uppercase)
    29→  const firstInitial = firstName.trim().charAt(0).toUpperCase();
    30→
    31→  // If lastName exists and is valid, add its first letter
    32→  if (lastName && typeof lastName === 'string' && lastName.trim().length > 0) {
    33→    const lastInitial = lastName.trim().charAt(0).toUpperCase();
    34→    return firstInitial + lastInitial;
    35→  }
    36→
    37→  // Return just first initial if no valid lastName
    38→  return firstInitial;
    39→}

     5→ * Check-in is the first selected day, check-out is the day AFTER the last selected day.
     6→ *
     7→ * @intent Determine the boundary days for a weekly split lease schedule.
     8→ * @rule Check-in is the first selected day in the sequence.
     9→ * @rule Check-out is the day AFTER the last selected day (handles wrap-around).
    10→ * @rule For wrap-around cases (e.g., Fri-Mon), identify the gap to determine boundaries.
    11→ *
    12→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    13→ * @param {number[]} params.selectedDays - Array of day indices (0-6, where 0=Sunday).
    14→ * @returns {object} Check-in/check-out details with day indices and names.
    15→ *
    16→ * @throws {Error} If selectedDays is not an array.
    17→ * @throws {Error} If selectedDays contains invalid day indices.
    18→ * @throws {Error} If selectedDays is empty.
    19→ *
    20→ * @example
    21→ * const result = calculateCheckInOutDays({ selectedDays: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] })
    22→ * // => { checkInDay: 1, checkOutDay: 6, checkInName: 'Monday', checkOutName: 'Saturday' }
    23→ *
    24→ * const wrapped = calculateCheckInOutDays({ selectedDays: [5, 6, 0, 1] })
    25→ * // => { checkInDay: 5, checkOutDay: 2, checkInName: 'Friday', checkOutName: 'Tuesday' }
    26→ */
    27→export function calculateCheckInOutDays({ selectedDays }) {
    28→  // No Fallback: Validate input
    29→  if (!Array.isArray(selectedDays)) {
    30→    throw new Error(
    31→      `calculateCheckInOutDays: selectedDays must be an array, got ${typeof selectedDays}`
    32→    )
    33→  }
    34→
    35→  if (selectedDays.length === 0) {
    36→    throw new Error(
    37→      'calculateCheckInOutDays: selectedDays cannot be empty'
    38→    )
    39→  }
    40→
    41→  // Validate all day indices
    42→  for (const day of selectedDays) {
    43→    if (typeof day !== 'number' || isNaN(day) || day < 0 || day > 6) {
    44→      throw new Error(
    45→        `calculateCheckInOutDays: Invalid day index ${day}, must be 0-6`
    46→      )
    47→    }
    48→  }
    49→
    50→  const sorted = [...selectedDays].sort((a, b) => a - b)
    51→
    52→  // Handle wrap-around case (selection includes both Sunday=0 and Saturday=6)
    53→  const hasZero = sorted.includes(0)
    54→  const hasSix = sorted.includes(6)
    55→
    56→  if (hasZero && hasSix) {
    57→    // Find gap to determine actual start/end
    58→    let gapIndex = -1
    59→    for (let i = 1; i < sorted.length; i++) {
    60→      if (sorted[i] !== sorted[i - 1] + 1) {
    61→        gapIndex = i
    62→        break
    63→      }
    64→    }
    65→
    66→    if (gapIndex !== -1) {
    67→      // Wrapped selection: check-in is after the gap
    68→      const checkInDay = sorted[gapIndex] // First day after gap
    69→      const lastSelectedDay = sorted[gapIndex - 1] // Last day before gap
    70→
    71→      // Check-out is the day AFTER the last selected day
    72→      const checkOutDay = (lastSelectedDay + 1) % 7
    73→
    74→      return {
    75→        checkInDay,
    76→        checkOutDay,
    77→        checkInName: DAY_NAMES[checkInDay],
    78→        checkOutName: DAY_NAMES[checkOutDay]
    79→      }
    80→    }
    81→  }
    82→
    83→  // Standard case: first selected day to day after last selected day
    84→  const checkInDay = sorted[0]
    85→  const lastSelectedDay = sorted[sorted.length - 1]
    86→
    87→  // Check-out is the day AFTER the last selected day (wraps around week if needed)
    88→  const checkOutDay = (lastSelectedDay + 1) % 7
    89→
    90→  return {
    91→    checkInDay,
    92→    checkOutDay,
    93→    checkInName: DAY_NAMES[checkInDay],
    94→    checkOutName: DAY_NAMES[checkOutDay]
    95→  }
    96→}
    97→

1→import { validateNonNegativeNumber, validateRange } from '../../validators/pricingValidators.js'
     2→
     3→/**
     4→ * Calculates the baseline rent for a standard 4-week period.
     5→ *
     6→ * @intent Determine the recurring monthly cost basis before fees.
     7→ * @rule Four weeks is the standard billing cycle for split lease.
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters for clarity.
    10→ * @param {number} params.nightlyRate - The base cost per night in USD.
    11→ * @param {number} params.frequency - The number of nights per week (2-7).

    17→ *
    18→ * @example
    19→ * const rent = calculateFourWeekRent({ nightlyRate: 100, frequency: 4 })
    20→ * // => 1600 (100 * 4 * 4)
    21→ */
    22→export function calculateFourWeekRent({ nightlyRate, frequency }) {
    23→  // No Fallback: Strict type validation
    24→  validateNonNegativeNumber(nightlyRate, 'nightlyRate', 'calculateFourWeekRent')
    25→  validateRange(frequency, 2, 7, 'frequency', 'calculateFourWeekRent')
    26→
    27→  // Pure calculation
    28→  return nightlyRate * frequency * 4
    29→}

1→/**
     2→ * Get nightly price based on number of nights selected.
     3→ * Matches Bubble logic for price field selection.
     4→ *
     5→ * @intent Retrieve the appropriate nightly rate tier based on frequency.
     6→ * @rule Price override takes precedence over frequency-based rates.
     7→ * @rule Frequency-specific rates (2, 3, 4, 5, 7 nights) map to specific price fields.
     8→ * @rule No fallback to default rate - throws if no valid rate found.
     9→ *
    10→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    11→ * @param {object} params.listing - Listing object with price fields.
    12→ * @param {number} params.nightsSelected - Number of nights per week (2-7).
    13→ * @returns {number} Nightly price for the selected frequency.
    14→ *
    15→ * @throws {Error} If listing is missing or invalid.
    16→ * @throws {Error} If nightsSelected is not a number or out of range.
    17→ * @throws {Error} If no valid price found for the selected nights.
    18→ *
    19→ * @example
    20→ * const rate = getNightlyRateByFrequency({
    21→ *   listing: { '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': 100 },
    22→ *   nightsSelected: 4
    23→ * })
    24→ * // => 100
    25→ */
    26→export function getNightlyRateByFrequency({ listing, nightsSelected }) {
    27→  // No Fallback: Validate listing exists
    28→  if (!listing || typeof listing !== 'object') {
    29→    throw new Error(
    30→      'getNightlyRateByFrequency: listing must be a valid object'
    31→    )
    32→  }
    33→
    34→  // No Fallback: Validate nightsSelected
    35→  if (typeof nightsSelected !== 'number' || isNaN(nightsSelected)) {
    36→    throw new Error(
    37→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: nightsSelected must be a number, got ${typeof nightsSelected}`
    38→    )
    39→  }
    40→
    41→  if (nightsSelected < 2 || nightsSelected > 7) {
    42→    throw new Error(
    43→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: nightsSelected must be between 2-7, got ${nightsSelected}`
    44→    )
    45→  }
    46→
    47→  // Price override takes precedence
    48→  if (listing['💰Price Override']) {
    49→    const overridePrice = Number(listing['💰Price Override'])
    50→    if (isNaN(overridePrice) || overridePrice < 0) {
    51→      throw new Error(
    52→        `getNightlyRateByFrequency: Invalid price override value ${listing['💰Price Override']}`
    53→      )
    54→    }
    55→    return overridePrice
    56→  }
    57→
    58→  // Map nights to price fields
    59→  const priceFieldMap = {
    60→    1: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 1 night',
    61→    2: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 2 nights',
    62→    3: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 3 nights',
    63→    4: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights',
    64→    5: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 5 nights',
    65→    6: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 6 nights',
    66→    7: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 7 nights'
    67→  }
    68→
    69→  const fieldName = priceFieldMap[nightsSelected]
    70→
    71→  // No Fallback: Exact match required
    72→  if (!fieldName || !listing[fieldName]) {
    73→    throw new Error(
    74→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: No price found for ${nightsSelected} nights in listing`
    75→    )
    76→  }
    77→
    78→  const rate = Number(listing[fieldName])
    79→
    80→  if (isNaN(rate) || rate < 0) {
    81→    throw new Error(
    82→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: Invalid rate value ${listing[fieldName]} for ${nightsSelected} nights`
    83→    )
    84→  }
    85→
    86→  return rate
    87→}
    88→

    10→ * @param {number} params.fourWeekRent - The calculated 4-week rent amount.

    18→ * @example
    19→ * const total = calculateReservationTotal({ fourWeekRent: 1600, totalWeeks: 13 })
    20→ * // => 5200 (1600 * 13 / 4)
    21→ */
    22→export function calculateReservationTotal({ fourWeekRent, totalWeeks }) {
    23→  // No Fallback: Strict type validation
    24→  validateNonNegativeNumber(fourWeekRent, 'fourWeekRent', 'calculateReservationTotal')
    25→  validatePositiveNumber(totalWeeks, 'totalWeeks', 'calculateReservationTotal')
    26→

1→/**
     2→ * Check if a date is within the available range.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Validate that a date falls within the listing's availability window.
     5→ * @rule Date must be >= firstAvailable (if specified).
     6→ * @rule Date must be <= lastAvailable (if specified).
     7→ * @rule Null/undefined bounds are treated as unbounded (no restriction).
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {Date} params.date - Date to check.
    11→ * @param {string|Date|null} params.firstAvailable - First available date (inclusive).
    12→ * @param {string|Date|null} params.lastAvailable - Last available date (inclusive).
    13→ * @returns {boolean} True if date is within range, false otherwise.
    14→ *
    15→ * @throws {Error} If date is not a valid Date object.
    16→ *
    17→ * @example
    18→ * const inRange = isDateInRange({
    19→ *   date: new Date('2025-12-15'),
    20→ *   firstAvailable: '2025-12-01',
    21→ *   lastAvailable: '2026-01-31'
    22→ * })
    23→ * // => true
    24→ */
    25→export function isDateInRange({ date, firstAvailable, lastAvailable }) {
    26→  // No Fallback: Validate date
    27→  if (!(date instanceof Date) || isNaN(date.getTime())) {
    28→    throw new Error(
    29→      'isDateInRange: date must be a valid Date object'
    30→    )
    31→  }
    32→
    33→  // Normalize check date (ignore time component)
    34→  const checkDate = new Date(date)
    35→  checkDate.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0)
    36→
    37→  // Check first available bound
    38→  if (firstAvailable !== null && firstAvailable !== undefined) {
    39→    const firstDate = new Date(firstAvailable)
    40→    if (isNaN(firstDate.getTime())) {
    41→      throw new Error(
    42→        `isDateInRange: firstAvailable is not a valid date: ${firstAvailable}`
    43→      )
    44→    }
    45→    firstDate.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0)
    46→    if (checkDate < firstDate) {
    47→      return false
    48→    }
    49→  }
    50→
    51→  // Check last available bound
    52→  if (lastAvailable !== null && lastAvailable !== undefined) {
    53→    const lastDate = new Date(lastAvailable)
    54→    if (isNaN(lastDate.getTime())) {
    55→      throw new Error(
    56→        `isDateInRange: lastAvailable is not a valid date: ${lastAvailable}`
    57→      )
    58→    }
    59→    lastDate.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0)
    60→    if (checkDate > lastDate) {
    61→      return false
    62→    }
    63→  }
    64→
    65→  return true
    66→}
    67→

1→/**
     2→ * Determine if a guest can cancel their proposal.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Enforce business rules for when proposal cancellation is allowed.
     5→ * @rule Guest can cancel proposals in stages 1-4 (before completion).
     6→ * @rule Once completed, proposals cannot be cancelled (only disputes apply).
     7→ * @rule Already cancelled/rejected/expired proposals cannot be re-cancelled.
     8→ * @rule Deleted proposals cannot be cancelled.
     9→ *
    10→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    11→ * @param {string} params.proposalStatus - The "Proposal Status" field from Supabase.
    12→ * @param {boolean} [params.deleted=false] - Whether proposal is soft-deleted.
    13→ * @returns {boolean} True if guest can cancel this proposal.
    14→ *
    15→ * @example
    16→ * canCancelProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Pending' })
    17→ * // => true
    18→ *
    19→ * canCancelProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Completed' })
    20→ * // => false
    21→ *
    22→ * canCancelProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Cancelled by Guest' })
    23→ * // => false (already cancelled)
    24→ */
    25→import { isTerminalStatus, isCompletedStatus } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'
    26→
    27→export function canCancelProposal({ proposalStatus, deleted = false }) {
    28→  // Deleted proposals cannot be cancelled
    29→  if (deleted) {
    30→    return false
    31→  }
    32→
    33→  // Validation
    34→  if (!proposalStatus || typeof proposalStatus !== 'string') {
    35→    return false
    36→  }
    37→
    38→  const status = proposalStatus.trim()
    39→
    40→  if (isTerminalStatus(status) || isCompletedStatus(status)) {
    41→    return false
    42→  }
    43→
    44→  // Can cancel if in any active state
    45→  // Includes: Draft, Pending, Host Countered, VM Requested, VM Confirmed, Accepted, Verified
    46→  return true
    47→}
    48→

1→/**
     2→ * Determine if a guest can accept a proposal (or host counteroffer).
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Enforce business rules for when proposal acceptance is allowed.
     5→ * @rule Guest can only accept when host has countered (Stage 2).
     6→ * @rule Original proposals don't need acceptance (they're sent to host).
     7→ * @rule Once accepted, VM scheduled, or cancelled, acceptance is not applicable.
     8→ * @rule Deleted proposals cannot be accepted.
     9→ *
    10→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    11→ * @param {string} params.proposalStatus - The "Proposal Status" field from Supabase.
    12→ * @param {boolean} [params.deleted=false] - Whether proposal is soft-deleted.
    13→ * @returns {boolean} True if guest can accept this proposal.
    14→ *
    15→ * @example
    16→ * canAcceptProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Host Countered' })
    17→ * // => true
    18→ *
    19→ * canAcceptProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Pending' })
    20→ * // => false (waiting for host, not guest)
    21→ *
    22→ * canAcceptProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Accepted' })
    23→ * // => false (already accepted)
    24→ */
    25→import { PROPOSAL_STATUSES } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'
    26→
    27→export function canAcceptProposal({ proposalStatus, deleted = false }) {
    28→  // Deleted proposals cannot be accepted
    29→  if (deleted) {
    30→    return false
    31→  }
    32→
    33→  // Validation
    34→  if (!proposalStatus || typeof proposalStatus !== 'string') {
    35→    return false
    36→  }
    37→
    38→  const status = proposalStatus.trim()
    39→
    40→  // Can only accept when host has countered
    41→  // This is the only status where guest needs to make an "accept" decision
    42→  return status === PROPOSAL_STATUSES.COUNTEROFFER_SUBMITTED_AWAITING_GUEST_REVIEW.key.trim()
    43→}

    14→ * @example
    15→ * canEditProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Pending' })
    16→ * // => true
    17→ *
    18→ * canEditProposal({ proposalStatus: 'Accepted' })
    19→ * // => false
    20→ */
    21→import { getActionsForStatus } from '../../constants/proposalStatuses.js'
    22→
    23→export function canEditProposal({ proposalStatus, deleted = false }) {
    24→  // Deleted proposals cannot be edited
    25→  if (deleted) {
    26→    return false
    27→  }
    28→
    29→  // Validation
    30→  if (!proposalStatus || typeof proposalStatus !== 'string') {
    31→    return false
    32→  }
    33→
    34→  const status = proposalStatus.trim()
    35→  const actions = getActionsForStatus(status)
    36→

    38→}

    18→ */
    19→export function hasProfilePhoto({ photoUrl }) {

    29→
    30→  // Empty string is considered "no photo"
    31→  return photoUrl.trim().length > 0;
    32→}

1→/**
     2→ * Format full host name to "FirstName L." format for privacy.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Format host name for display with privacy (show first name + last initial).
     5→ * @rule NO FALLBACK: Throws error if name is invalid.
     6→ * @rule Single name: Return as-is (e.g., "John" → "John").
     7→ * @rule Multiple names: Return "FirstName L." (e.g., "John Smith" → "John S.").
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {string} params.fullName - Full name of the host.
    11→ * @returns {string} Formatted name with last initial.
    12→ *
    13→ * @throws {Error} If fullName is not a string or is empty.
    14→ *
    15→ * @example
    16→ * const formatted = formatHostName({ fullName: 'John Smith' })
    17→ * // => "John S."
    18→ *
    19→ * const single = formatHostName({ fullName: 'John' })
    20→ * // => "John"
    21→ */
    22→export function formatHostName({ fullName }) {
    23→  // No Fallback: Strict validation
    24→  if (typeof fullName !== 'string') {
    25→    throw new Error(
    26→      `formatHostName: fullName must be a string, got ${typeof fullName}`
    27→    )
    28→  }
    29→
    30→  const trimmedName = fullName.trim()
    31→
    32→  if (!trimmedName || trimmedName.length === 0) {
    33→    throw new Error('formatHostName: fullName cannot be empty or whitespace')
    34→  }
    35→
    36→  // Split name into parts
    37→  const nameParts = trimmedName.split(/\s+/)
    38→
    39→  // Single name: return as-is
    40→  if (nameParts.length === 1) {
    41→    return nameParts[0]
    42→  }
    43→
    44→  // Multiple names: "FirstName L."
    45→  const firstName = nameParts[0]
    46→  const lastInitial = nameParts[nameParts.length - 1].charAt(0).toUpperCase()
    47→
    48→  return `${firstName} ${lastInitial}.`
    49→}
    50→

1→/**
     2→ * Calculate price proximity ratio between candidate listing and proposal.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Measure how close candidate pricing is to proposal budget.
     5→ * @rule Returns absolute difference as decimal ratio (0.0 = exact match).
     6→ * @rule Uses matching night count for fair comparison.
     7→ * @rule Throws if proposal nightly price is missing or invalid.
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {number} params.candidateNightlyRate - Candidate listing's nightly rate.
    11→ * @param {number} params.proposalNightlyRate - Proposal's nightly rate.
    12→ * @returns {number} Price difference as decimal (e.g., 0.15 = 15% difference).
    13→ *
    14→ * @throws {Error} If proposalNightlyRate is missing, zero, or invalid.
    15→ *
    16→ * @example
    17→ * calculatePriceProximity({
    18→ *   candidateNightlyRate: 115,
    19→ *   proposalNightlyRate: 100
    20→ * })
    21→ * // => 0.15 (15% higher)
    22→ *
    23→ * calculatePriceProximity({
    24→ *   candidateNightlyRate: 85,
    25→ *   proposalNightlyRate: 100
    26→ * })
    27→ * // => 0.15 (15% lower - absolute value)
    28→ */
    29→export function calculatePriceProximity({ candidateNightlyRate, proposalNightlyRate }) {
    30→  // Validate proposal rate
    31→  if (typeof proposalNightlyRate !== 'number' || isNaN(proposalNightlyRate)) {
    32→    throw new Error(
    33→      `calculatePriceProximity: proposalNightlyRate must be a valid number, got ${typeof proposalNightlyRate}`
    34→    );
    35→  }
    36→
    37→  if (proposalNightlyRate <= 0) {
    38→    throw new Error(
    39→      'calculatePriceProximity: proposalNightlyRate must be greater than 0'
    40→    );
    41→  }
    42→
    43→  // Validate candidate rate
    44→  if (typeof candidateNightlyRate !== 'number' || isNaN(candidateNightlyRate)) {
    45→    throw new Error(
    46→      `calculatePriceProximity: candidateNightlyRate must be a valid number, got ${typeof candidateNightlyRate}`
    47→    );
    48→  }
    49→
    50→  if (candidateNightlyRate < 0) {
    51→    throw new Error(
    52→      'calculatePriceProximity: candidateNightlyRate cannot be negative'
    53→    );
    54→  }
    55→
    56→  const priceDifference = Math.abs(candidateNightlyRate - proposalNightlyRate);
    57→  const proximityRatio = priceDifference / proposalNightlyRate;
    58→
    59→  return proximityRatio;
    60→}
    61→

1→/**
     2→ * adaptLeaseFromSupabase - Transform raw Supabase lease data to frontend model
     3→ *
     4→ * Handles the mapping between Bubble.io's column naming conventions
     5→ * (spaces, mixed case) and our frontend's camelCase conventions.
     6→ *
     7→ * @param {Object} row - Raw row from bookings_leases table
     8→ * @returns {Object} Adapted lease object for frontend use
     9→ */
    10→
    11→/**
    12→ * Map Bubble.io lease status values to normalized strings
    13→ * @param {string} rawStatus - Raw status from database
    14→ * @returns {string} Normalized status
    15→ */
    16→function mapLeaseStatus(rawStatus) {
    17→  if (!rawStatus) return 'unknown';
    18→
    19→  const statusMap = {
    20→    'Active': 'active',
    21→    'active': 'active',
    22→    'Completed': 'completed',
    23→    'completed': 'completed',
    24→    'Cancelled': 'cancelled',
    25→    'cancelled': 'cancelled',
    26→    'Pending': 'pending',
    27→    'pending': 'pending',
    28→    'Draft': 'draft',
    29→    'draft': 'draft',
    30→  };
    31→
    32→  return statusMap[rawStatus] || rawStatus.toLowerCase();
    33→}
    34→
    35→/**
    36→ * Safely parse a date string
    37→ * @param {string|null} dateStr - Date string or null
    38→ * @returns {Date|null} Parsed Date or null
    39→ */
    40→function parseDate(dateStr) {
    41→  if (!dateStr) return null;
    42→  const parsed = new Date(dateStr);
    43→  return isNaN(parsed.getTime()) ? null : parsed;
    44→}
    45→
    46→/**
    47→ * Adapt a single lease record from Supabase format
    48→ * @param {Object} row - Raw bookings_leases row with joins
    49→ * @returns {Object} Frontend-friendly lease object
    50→ */
    51→export function adaptLeaseFromSupabase(row) {
    52→  if (!row) return null;
    53→
    54→  return {
    55→    // Core identifiers
    56→    id: row._id,
    57→    bubbleId: row.bubble_id,
    58→    agreementNumber: row['Agreement Number'] || null,
    59→
    60→    // Status
    61→    status: mapLeaseStatus(row['Lease Status']),
    62→    leaseSigned: row['Lease signed?'] || false,
    63→
    64→    // Dates
    65→    startDate: parseDate(row['Reservation Period : Start']),
    66→    endDate: parseDate(row['Reservation Period : End']),
    67→    createdAt: parseDate(row['Created Date']),
    68→    modifiedAt: parseDate(row['Modified Date']),
    69→    firstPaymentDate: parseDate(row['First Payment Date']),
    70→
    71→    // Financial
    72→    totalRent: parseFloat(row['Total Rent']) || 0,
    73→    totalCompensation: parseFloat(row['Total Compensation']) || 0,
    74→    paidToDate: parseFloat(row['Paid to Date from Guest']) || 0,
    75→
    76→    // Week tracking
    77→    currentWeekNumber: parseInt(row['current week number']) || null,
    78→    totalWeekCount: parseInt(row['total week count']) || null,
    79→
    80→    // Related entities (adapted from joins)
    81→    guest: row.guest ? adaptUserFromSupabase(row.guest) : null,
    82→    host: row.host ? adaptUserFromSupabase(row.host) : null,
    83→    listing: row.listing ? adaptListingFromSupabase(row.listing) : null,
    84→    proposal: row.proposal ? { id: row.proposal._id } : null,
    85→
    86→    // Stays (from join or JSONB)
    87→    stays: Array.isArray(row.stays)
    88→      ? row.stays.map(adaptStayFromSupabase)
    89→      : parseJsonbArray(row['List of Stays']),
    90→
    91→    // Documents (if attached)
    92→    documents: row.documents || [],
    93→
    94→    // Other fields
    95→    thread: row.Thread || null,
    96→    cancellationPolicy: row['Cancellation Policy'] || null,
    97→    hostPayoutSchedule: row['Host Payout Schedule'] || null,
    98→    wereDocumentsGenerated: row['were documents generated?'] || false,
    99→
   100→    // Throttling flags
   101→    throttling: {
   102→      guestCanCreateRequests: row['Throttling - guest ability to create requests?'] ?? true,
   103→      hostCanCreateRequests: row['Throttling- host ability to create requests?'] ?? true,
   104→      guestShowWarning: !row['Throttling - guest NOT show warning popup'],
   105→      hostShowWarning: !row['Throttling - host NOT show warning popup'],
   106→    },
   107→
   108→    // Reputation
   109→    guestReputationScore: parseInt(row['Reputation Score (GUEST)']) || null,
   110→    hostReputationScore: parseInt(row['Reputation Score (HOST)']) || null,
   111→
   112→    // Sync status
   113→    pending: row.pending || false,
   114→  };
   115→}
   116→
   117→/**
   118→ * Adapt user data from Supabase join
   119→ */
   120→function adaptUserFromSupabase(user) {
   121→  if (!user) return null;
   122→
   123→  return {
   124→    id: user._id,
   125→    email: user.email || user.Email || null,
   126→    firstName: user['First Name'] || user.first_name || null,
   127→    lastName: user['Last Name'] || user.last_name || null,
   128→    phone: user.Phone || user.phone || null,
   129→    avatarUrl: user['Profile Photo'] || user.avatar_url || null,
   130→  };
   131→}
   132→
   133→/**
   134→ * Adapt listing data from Supabase join
   135→ */
   136→function adaptListingFromSupabase(listing) {
   137→  if (!listing) return null;
   138→
   139→  return {
   140→    id: listing._id,
   141→    name: listing['Listing Title'] || listing.name || 'Unnamed Listing',
   142→    address: listing.Address || listing.address || null,
   143→    neighborhood: listing.Neighborhood || listing.neighborhood || null,
   144→    city: listing.City || listing.city || null,
   145→    state: listing.State || listing.state || null,
   146→    zipCode: listing['Zip Code'] || listing.zip_code || null,
   147→    imageUrl: listing['Primary Image'] || listing.image_url || null,
   148→  };
   149→}
   150→
   151→/**
   152→ * Adapt stay data from Supabase join
   153→ */
   154→function adaptStayFromSupabase(stay) {
   155→  if (!stay) return null;
   156→
   157→  return {
   158→    id: stay._id,
   159→    status: stay['Stay Status'] || 'unknown',
   160→    checkIn: parseDate(stay['Check In (night)']),
   161→    checkOut: parseDate(stay['Check-out day']),
   162→    lastNight: parseDate(stay['Last Night (night)']),
   163→    weekNumber: parseInt(stay['Week Number']) || null,
   164→    amount: parseFloat(stay.Amount) || 0,
   165→    firstIndex: parseInt(stay['first index']) || null,
   166→    lastIndex: parseInt(stay['last index']) || null,
   167→    nights: parseJsonbArray(stay.Nights),
   168→  };
   169→}
   170→
   171→/**
   172→ * Safely parse JSONB array field
   173→ */
   174→function parseJsonbArray(jsonbField) {
   175→  if (Array.isArray(jsonbField)) return jsonbField;
   176→  if (typeof jsonbField === 'string') {
   177→    try {
   178→      return JSON.parse(jsonbField);
   179→    } catch {
   180→      return [];
   181→    }
   182→  }
   183→  return [];
   184→}
   185→
   186→export default adaptLeaseFromSupabase;
   187→

1→/**
     2→ * Lease temporal status rules
     3→ *
     4→ * These functions determine lease status based on dates.
     5→ * All accept an optional `asOf` date parameter for testability.
     6→ */
     7→
     8→/**
     9→ * isLeaseActive - Check if a lease is currently active
    10→ *
    11→ * @intent Determine if a lease is in active status and within its date range
    12→ * @rule Status must be 'active'
    13→ * @rule If no dates set, consider active based on status alone
    14→ * @rule Must be on or after startDate (if set)
    15→ * @rule Must be on or before endDate (if set)
    16→ *
    17→ * @param {Object} lease - Adapted lease object
    18→ * @param {Date} [asOf=new Date()] - Reference date for comparison (enables testing)
    19→ * @returns {boolean} Whether the lease is currently active
    20→ *
    21→ * @example
    22→ * isLeaseActive({ status: 'active', startDate: yesterday, endDate: tomorrow }) // true
    23→ * isLeaseActive({ status: 'active', startDate: tomorrow }) // false (not started)
    24→ */
    25→export function isLeaseActive(lease, asOf = new Date()) {
    26→  if (!lease) return false;
    27→
    28→  // Status must be 'active'
    29→  if (lease.status !== 'active') {
    30→    return false;
    31→  }
    32→
    33→  // If no dates set, consider it active based on status alone
    34→  if (!lease.startDate && !lease.endDate) {
    35→    return true;
    36→  }
    37→
    38→  // Check if we're within the date range
    39→  const isAfterStart = !lease.startDate || asOf >= lease.startDate;
    40→  const isBeforeEnd = !lease.endDate || asOf <= lease.endDate;
    41→
    42→  return isAfterStart && isBeforeEnd;
    43→}
    44→
    45→/**
    46→ * isLeaseUpcoming - Check if a lease is scheduled but not started
    47→ *
    48→ * @intent Determine if a lease will begin in the future
    49→ * @rule Status must be 'active' or 'pending'
    50→ * @rule startDate must exist and be in the future
    51→ *
    52→ * @param {Object} lease - Adapted lease object
    53→ * @param {Date} [asOf=new Date()] - Reference date for comparison (enables testing)
    54→ * @returns {boolean} Whether the lease is upcoming
    55→ *
    56→ * @example
    57→ * isLeaseUpcoming({ status: 'active', startDate: tomorrow }) // true
    58→ * isLeaseUpcoming({ status: 'active', startDate: yesterday }) // false
    59→ */
    60→export function isLeaseUpcoming(lease, asOf = new Date()) {
    61→  if (!lease) return false;
    62→
    63→  const validStatuses = ['active', 'pending'];
    64→  if (!validStatuses.includes(lease.status)) return false;
    65→
    66→  if (!lease.startDate) return false;
    67→
    68→  return asOf < lease.startDate;
    69→}
    70→
    71→/**
    72→ * isLeaseExpired - Check if a lease has passed its end date
    73→ *
    74→ * @intent Determine if a lease's end date has passed
    75→ * @rule endDate must exist and be in the past
    76→ *
    77→ * @param {Object} lease - Adapted lease object
    78→ * @param {Date} [asOf=new Date()] - Reference date for comparison (enables testing)
    79→ * @returns {boolean} Whether the lease has expired
    80→ *
    81→ * @example
    82→ * isLeaseExpired({ endDate: yesterday }) // true
    83→ * isLeaseExpired({ endDate: tomorrow }) // false
    84→ * isLeaseExpired({ endDate: null }) // false
    85→ */
    86→export function isLeaseExpired(lease, asOf = new Date()) {
    87→  if (!lease) return false;
    88→  if (!lease.endDate) return false;
    89→
    90→  return asOf > lease.endDate;
    91→}
    92→
    93→export default isLeaseActive;
    94→

1→/**
     2→ * canDeleteLease - Determine if a lease can be soft-deleted (cancelled)
     3→ *
     4→ * Business Rules:
     5→ * - Draft leases can always be cancelled
     6→ * - Pending leases can be cancelled
     7→ * - Active leases can be cancelled (but may have implications)
     8→ * - Already cancelled leases cannot be re-cancelled
     9→ * - Completed leases cannot be cancelled
    10→ *
    11→ * @param {Object} lease - Adapted lease object
    12→ * @returns {boolean} Whether the lease can be soft-deleted
    13→ */
    14→export function canDeleteLease(lease) {
    15→  if (!lease) return false;
    16→
    17→  const nonDeletableStatuses = ['cancelled', 'completed'];
    18→
    19→  return !nonDeletableStatuses.includes(lease.status);
    20→}
    21→
    22→export default canDeleteLease;
    23→

1→/**
     2→ * Lease filtering processor
     3→ *
     4→ * Pure function that returns a new filtered array without mutating input.
     5→ */
     6→
     7→/**
     8→ * Extract searchable text fields from a lease
     9→ *
    10→ * @param {Object} lease - Adapted lease object
    11→ * @returns {string[]} Array of searchable field values
    12→ */
    13→const getSearchableFields = (lease) => [
    14→  lease.id,
    15→  lease.agreementNumber,
    16→  lease.guest?.email,
    17→  lease.guest?.firstName,
    18→  lease.guest?.lastName,
    19→  lease.host?.email,
    20→  lease.host?.firstName,
    21→  lease.host?.lastName,
    22→  lease.listing?.name,
    23→  lease.listing?.address,
    24→  lease.listing?.neighborhood,
    25→];
    26→
    27→/**
    28→ * Check if a lease matches the status filter
    29→ *
    30→ * @param {Object} lease - Adapted lease object
    31→ * @param {string} statusFilter - Status to filter by ('all' to skip)
    32→ * @returns {boolean} Whether the lease matches the status filter
    33→ */
    34→const matchesStatusFilter = (lease, statusFilter) =>
    35→  !statusFilter || statusFilter === 'all' || lease.status === statusFilter;
    36→
    37→/**
    38→ * Check if a lease matches the search query
    39→ *
    40→ * @param {Object} lease - Adapted lease object
    41→ * @param {string} query - Lowercase, trimmed search query
    42→ * @returns {boolean} Whether the lease matches the search query
    43→ */
    44→const matchesSearchQuery = (lease, query) => {
    45→  if (!query) return true;
    46→
    47→  return getSearchableFields(lease).some(
    48→    (field) => field && String(field).toLowerCase().includes(query)
    49→  );
    50→};
    51→
    52→/**
    53→ * filterLeases - Filter leases by search query and status
    54→ *
    55→ * @intent Filter lease list by status and/or text search across multiple fields
    56→ * @rule Returns empty array for non-array input
    57→ * @rule Status filter 'all' shows all statuses
    58→ * @rule Search is case-insensitive and matches partial strings
    59→ *
    60→ * @param {Array} leases - Array of adapted lease objects
    61→ * @param {Object} filters - Filter configuration
    62→ * @param {string} [filters.searchQuery=''] - Text search query
    63→ * @param {string} [filters.statusFilter='all'] - Status to filter by ('all' for no filter)
    64→ * @returns {Array} Filtered leases (new array, doesn't mutate input)
    65→ *
    66→ * @example
    67→ * filterLeases(leases, { statusFilter: 'active' })
    68→ * filterLeases(leases, { searchQuery: 'john', statusFilter: 'all' })
    69→ */
    70→export function filterLeases(leases, { searchQuery = '', statusFilter = 'all' } = {}) {
    71→  if (!Array.isArray(leases)) return [];
    72→
    73→  const normalizedQuery = searchQuery.toLowerCase().trim();
    74→
    75→  return leases.filter((lease) =>
    76→    matchesStatusFilter(lease, statusFilter) &&
    77→    matchesSearchQuery(lease, normalizedQuery)
    78→  );
    79→}
    80→
    81→export default filterLeases;
    82→

1→/**
     2→ * Validate if enough days are selected for price calculation.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Enforce minimum and maximum day selection for pricing.
     5→ * @rule Minimum 2 days required (2 nights).
     6→ * @rule Maximum 7 days allowed (full week).
     7→ *
     8→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
     9→ * @param {number} params.daysSelected - Number of days selected.
    10→ * @returns {boolean} True if valid for pricing, false otherwise.
    11→ *
    12→ * @throws {Error} If daysSelected is not a number.
    13→ *
    14→ * @example
    15→ * isValidDayCountForPricing({ daysSelected: 4 }) // => true
    16→ * isValidDayCountForPricing({ daysSelected: 1 }) // => false
    17→ * isValidDayCountForPricing({ daysSelected: 8 }) // => false
    18→ */
